>
>The fact that *at the moment* web browsers do not take into account
>the difference between a 404 & 410 and reload a 410 is irrelevant.
>Would you consider it an error if a browser saved a little bandwidth
>and didn’t really reload a 410? I wouldn’t.
>

Well, I do stand corrected, 410 responses MAY be cached.  However, if 
I have marked the 410 response explicitly with a no-cache directive I 
would indeed consider that an error, just as I would consider it to 
be an error if a client cached a 404 response.

>
>Additionally, if a HEAD returns 410, why should a software client be
>expected to believe that a DELETE might have any meaningful effect on
>that resource?
>

Good point, unless the 410 is marked no-cache.

-Eric
